ibis.io

Class ByteSerializationOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.io.ByteSerializationOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataOutput, SerializationOutput
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataSerializationOutputStream

    public class ByteSerializationOutputStream
extends java.lang.Object
implements SerializationOutput
    The ByteSerializationOutputStream class can be used when only byte serialization is needed. It provides an implementation for the SerializationOutput interface, built on methods in OutputStream. However, the only data that can be sent are bytes and byte arrays. All other methods throw an exception. It also provides a base class for "data" serialization and "ibis" serialization.

      • setReplacer

        public void setReplacer(Replacer replacer)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: SerializationOutput
        Set a replacer. The replacement mechanism can be used to replace an object with another object during serialization. This is used in RMI, for instance, to replace a remote object with a stub.
        Specified by:
        setReplacer in interface SerializationOutput
        Parameters:
        replacer - the replacer object to be associated with this output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when the implementation refuses to set the replacer, for instance when it is not an object serialization.

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(java.lang.Object obj)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: SerializationOutput
        Writes a Serializable object to the output. A duplicate check for this String object is performed: if the object was already written to this output, a handle for this object is written instead of the object itself.
        Specified by:
        writeObject in interface SerializationOutput
        Parameters:
        obj - the object value to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        obj - the string to write.
